Title: Product Policy Analyst, Civic Integrity - USDS
Description:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok U.S. Data Security
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a subsidary of TikTok in the U.S. This new, security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and U.S. user data, so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span across Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

About the Team
This role will sit within the USDS Product Policy Team and specialize in Integrity and Authenticity. Maximizing our commitment to free expression while ensuring the safety of our community is the team's north star. You will need to cultivate a deep understanding of the platform, its features and workflows, and its diverse community. The role will need to apply this knowledge to ensure that our policies and enforcement processes respect political speech as well as one's ability to express political opinions. We are dedicated to mitigating real world harm while safeguarding civic institutions and processes, like voting and political engagement. This will require developing systems for tracking and anticipating user behavior and identifying thoughtful and creative policy solutions in a rapidly-changing environment. You will work closely with a variety of internal partners including global policy experts on Integrity and Elections,Threat Discovery and Prevention, Product, and Legal Policy Operations to ensure that TikTok is able to detect, triage, and prevent safety incidents. It can be based in Los Angeles or New York.
Our Product Policy team performs a critical function that supports our efforts to address objectionable or disturbing content. Content that the Product Policy team interacts with includes images, video, and text related to every-day life, but it can also include (but is not limited to) bullying; hate speech; child abuse; sexual assault; torture; bestiality; self-harm; suicide; and murder. 
It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
- Rapidly assess large volumes of user content and provide policy calibrations based on ever-changing real-world contexts
- Rely on data-driven assessments of integrity and authenticity content to inform policy development, training and scaling of enforcement tools 
- Support preparation for the platform's election and civic integrity work by detecting policy edge cases and proposing scalable solutions
- Proactively identify and evaluate emerging misinformation and conspiracy narratives and other real-world risks to our platform and drive solutions to help mitigate them 
- Work closely with cross-functional partners and external experts to stay up-to-date on emerging political, demographic, scientific and social media trends in the US to predict and prevent violations of TikTok's community guidelines 
- Assist team lead in providing comprehensive and ongoing training designed to inform the moderators about policy, procedures changes, recent trends, and updates
- Become conversant with new tactics, techniques, and patterns used by adversarial and abusive parties to interfere with critical civic processes, spread harmful misinformation, and circumvent platform safety mechanisms. 
- Execute research projects and provide summaries about salient new academic work on misinformation and content safety interventions. Responsibilities include research, work planning, data collection & analysis
- Analyze existing policies and procedures to identify gaps, inconsistencies, or conflicts 

Qualifications

 Qualifications
- Over 3 years of work experience in Trust & Safety, content policy, or brand safety roles or another relevant field with a focus on civic Integrity (i.e, elections) and harmful misinformation 
- A deep interest in and knowledge about current events and politics
- Experience with trust and safety best practices, safety models, scalable solutions, safety by design principles and technical tools
- Ability to work with multiple external partners (i.e., vendor operations) to ensure our policy and procedure expectations are met 
- A careful and systematic thought process about how to leverage data and insights to inform policy development
- Some background in operations, with a proven ability to structure policy and process-oriented milestones 
- Deep knowledge in how policy develops in new media, technology, entertainment, or related fields

Preferred qualifications:
- Understanding how machine learning models are applied to safety problems
- Familiarity with AI-generated content trends
- Proven ability to develop sound research methodologies and collect, synthesize, analyze, and interpret data
- Experience managing complex research projects
- Experience working in a start-up, or forming new teams in established companies
- Advanced proficiency in Excel and understanding of data access tools, including but not limited to SQL
- Your ability to work in a high tempo environment, adapt, respond to day-to-day challenges of the role.
- Your resilience and commitment to self-care to manage the emotional demands of the role.

Wellbeing Statement
Trust & Safety recognizes that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job. It can be rewarding, psychologically demanding, and emotionally taxing. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start: so our candidates are well informed before proceeding.

We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

D&I Statement
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Accommodation Statement
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/ktJP6

Data Security Statement
This role requires the ability to work with and support systems designed to protect sensitive data and information. As such, this role will be subject to strict national security-related screening.

Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees: We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care. Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability. We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

Title: Green House Gas Policy Analyst
Description:
At PGE, our work involves dreaming about, planning for, and realizing a smarter, cleaner, more enduring Oregon neighborhood. Its core to our DNA and we haven’t stopped since we started in 1888. We energize lives, strengthen communities and drive advancements in energy that promote social, economic and environmental progress. We’re always on the lookout for people passionate about leading and being a part of teams that are advancing innovative clean energy solutions that are also affordable and accessible to all.

This is an exciting time to join Portland General Electric. As Oregon’s largest electric utility, Portland General Electric is leading an energy transformation that will harness the power of clean and renewable resources. Our vision for a clean energy future relies on three interrelated and overarching strategies: de-carbonize through investing in clean and reliable energy; modernize through a smarter more resilient grid; and empower our customers in their energy technology choices.

We’re searching for an innovative, customer and results-obsessed leaders to help power our mission and lead the way in championing the world’s clean energy future!

PGE has committed to reducing emissions associated with the power we serve to our customers by 80% by 2030, with an aspirational goal of zero emissions with the power we serve to our customers by 2040. We also aim to achieve net zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across the rest of our company’s operations by 2040. With these ambitious goals in mind and our customers’ needs at our core, we are looking to build out our Policy, Resource Planning and Sustainability Strategy team with a senior GHG Policy Analyst.

The GHG Policy Analyst will report directly to the Senior Director of Policy, Planning, and Sustainability and will bring in-depth knowledge and experience; use best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services; solve complex problems; take a new perspective using existing solutions; work independently, receive minimal guidance, and will act as a resource for colleagues across the organization.

We're hiring for a position open to both principal-level and senior principal-level candidates. The level will be determined based on the successful applicant's qualifications, experience, and demonstrated skills during the interview process. 

Key Responsibilities:

Specialization

 Mange PGE’s GHG policy and planning GHG forecasting and policy modeling to support decarbonization efforts, resource, and program planning, including planning for emissions compliance targets, net zero and science-based targets.  Oversee carbon reporting inventories, methodologies, disclosures, and messaging for regulatory compliance, and support of customer clean energy goals.  Specializes in research and analysis. 

Research & Analysis

 Uses data and analytics to drive development or changes in strategy development.  Research, develop, and implement policies that improve the organization’s environmental impact without detracting from other business goals.  Develops reports, including graphics and visuals customized to individual audiences. 

Compliance, & Process Management 

 Coordinate with Finance and Environmental team on GHG data collection, controls, compliance, and related disclosures.  Manage key GHG performance metrics, report, and communicate across the company and in investor facing documents.  Ensures processes and deliverables meet regulatory requirements and guidelines. 

Stakeholder Engagement

 Engage with key internal and external stakeholders.  Coordination of PGE GHG reporting methodologies across states and organized markets. 

Education/Experience/Certifications

 Requires a bachelor’s degree in business, economics, accounting, environmental or public policy, sustainability, or related discipline or equivalent experience.  Typically, eight (principal), twelve (senior principal) or more years in utility or similar energy sector experience in the area(s) of environmental policy and decarbonization, GHG modeling, or environmental policy; corporate sustainability experience; or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience. 

Compensation Range:

$101,925.00 - $210,340.00

In addition, this position is eligible for a performance-based incentive bonus. Actual total compensation is commensurate with experience, skills, and education

PGE believes in rewarding dedicated performance. We provide a total rewards package that is designed to reward your contributions to the company, and, at the same time, support your well-being and professional development, both now and into the future. To find out more, click here.

Title: Anticorruption Policy Analyst - Level 4
Description:
About Us:

Totally Joined For Achieving Collaborative Techniques (TJFACT) is a minority-owned, CVE-verified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) performance driven professional services government contracting company that provides a broad spectrum of services and solutions to the U.S. government agencies and organizations.

About the Position: 

TJFACT is seeking to hire a well-qualified Anticorruption Policy Analyst – Level 4 to join our Team in Washington, DC supporting DOS INL.

The Anti-Corruption Management Analyst (referred to as Analyst for the remainder of the document) will serve in a several person unit, reporting to the Team Lead or his/her designee. The Analyst will support the design and implementation of anti-corruption policy, doctrine, and other lines of engagement the Department. The Analyst will support the coordinator’s participation in internal anti-corruption policy processes and coordination mechanisms by gathering information, engaging with counterparts from the Department, the Interagency, the Intelligence Community, and wider stakeholders. In addition, the Analyst will support the coordinator’s external engagements, including assisting in the preparation of remarks and other materials for public engagements. The Analyst will also support efforts to expand Department messaging on anti-corruption, including through supporting the work of the team in developing new partnerships with civil society and the private sector. The Analyst will also support the team’s efforts to expand anti-corruption expertise and training within the Department, including engaging with the Intelligence Community and assisting in developing new anti-corruption knowledge products, in coordination with INL’s Office of Knowledge Management and other relevant stakeholders. Finally, the Analyst would support the team’s efforts to expand the Department and INL strategic and over-the-horizon analysis of corruption and anti-corruption countermeasures, to include research and analysis on new legislative initiatives and responses to Congressional requirements.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Support the Coordinator’s efforts to advance wide ranging anti-corruption initiatives with the aim of elevating the fight against corruption as a key element of U.S. foreign policy.Guide the Coordinator’s participation in meetings with Bureau, Department, interagency, intergovernmental, and outside organizations on issues related to anti-corruption.Support efforts to cultivate and develop contacts with partner federal agencies, including DOJ, Treasury, Commerce, and the Intelligence Community.Assist the Coordinator’s team in developing and strengthening coordination mechanisms within the Department; support the coordinator’s outreach to interagency partners, including Treasury, USAID, Commerce, DoD, and the Intelligence Community.Coordinate and develop effective lines of communication within INL, the Department, and with interagency counterparts engaged in advancing anti-corruption policies and programs to ensure consistent and complementary approaches.Aid efforts to build partnerships with civil society and the private sector to identify and share information on subjects relevant to the topic of countering corruption and promote wider dissemination, including efforts to disseminate knowledge in this field across INL, the Department, and with wider stakeholders.Support the development of strategic and over-the-horizon analysis of corruption and corruption countermeasures, including analysis of new legislative initiatives.Support the Coordinator’s engagement with the U.S. Congress on anti-corruption issues, including by assisting on development of testimony, briefings, and feedback on legislative proposals and reporting requirements. Support the Coordinator’s responses to other oversight requests.Assist efforts to expand anti-corruption expertise and training within the Department, in coordination with INL’s Office of Knowledge Management and other relevant stakeholders.Provide input, analysis, and expert advisory support on anti-corruption-focused foreign assistance projects.Support the team’s efforts to expand Department public-facing messaging on anti- corruption as a core public diplomacy priority, including contributing to the development of press materials such as press releases, speeches, and social media posts.

Required Skills and Experience:

Must be a U.S. Citizen or legal U.S. resident.A bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution.A Master’s or equivalent postgraduate degree from an accredited institution in a field related to the primary duties of this position, including but not limited to Law, International Affairs, Political Science, or Public Administration.Six to ten years’ experience in relevant field.Demonstrated knowledge of Federal regulations in regard to area of specific need.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.Demonstrated experience facilitating organizational change.

Preferred Qualifications:

Demonstrated previous experience in government, civil society, think tanks, or the private sector working on anti-corruption-related policy or regulatory issues, or on advancing programmatic initiatives related to anti-corruption.Demonstrated experience leading or substantively contributing to anti-corruption-related advocacy campaigns, regional foreign policy efforts, government initiatives, academic or policy-oriented research projects; advising private sector entities on issues related to anti- corruption; or advising on the development of U.S. foreign policy in a particular country or region on issues such as countering corruption and promoting transparency.Demonstrated ability to work seamlessly with team members, advocate effectively within and outside the organization to achieve objectives, and maintain strong working relationships with a variety of stakeholders.Demonstrated superior writing, communication and interpersonal skills.

Benefits:

Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance401-K plus matchPaid Vacation daysPaid holidaysShort Term and Long Term DisabilityVoluntary Term Life

Description:
Job Overview

The Policy & Process Analyst provides support to the department with documenting and evaluating business policy and process procedures. Assesses the impact to the Business Line's organization and processes. Coordinates process alignment recommendations with department management and facilitates changes. Assists in monitoring process improvements identified by the Business Line.

Expected work hours

40 hours a week

Job Description

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Oversee and assess existing processes and workflows while considering interdependencies, procedures, and requirements. Optimize productivity by designing, implementing, and testing new procedures and process maps. Assemble reports to document process status and changes, measuring efficiency gains. Maintain, update and drive the documentation of policy and procedures throughout the department, keeping them up to date in accordance with requirements. Track metrics and make suggestions on areas for improvement. Communicate findings and proposals to upper management. Provide thorough instructions for successful implementation of process changes. Work with partners to evaluate compliance and risk assessments. Provide thought leadership on business process excellence and continuous improvement. Excellent analytical skills. Ability to exercise initiative, problem identification, problem solving and independent decision making. Ability to persuade others to change existing practices. Skilled in MS Office Applications including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Experience working in a financial institution. Ability to coordinate amongst multiple teams to meet project-based deadlines. Ability to thrive under pressure, multi-task and manage competing priorities.

REPORTS TO: Senior Director of Industry

Position Summary

The Policy Analyst will support the Senior Director of Industry with research into the technologies and policies that will decarbonize manufacturing and industrial processes. They will communicate technology and policy opportunities through reports, data analyses, visualizations, and presentations to policymakers and non-technical audiences with a primary focus on the United States, China, Europe, and India.

OUR COMMITMENT

Energy Innovation is committed to diversity, equity, & inclusion and to a transparent recruitment process that fosters belonging. Our goal is to hire and advance people regardless of race, gender, ability, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, military service, medical condition, and any other protected characteristic under local, state, or federal law. We are committed to an accessible application process and employee experience. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process, please email jobs@energyinnovation.org.

Research and Data Analysis

Research technologies and industrial processes that can be deployed to rapidly reduce greenhouse gas emissions across industries such as iron & steel, cement, chemicals and plastics, refining, and food processingResearch policies that can accelerate the transition to clean industry, and the optimal way to design those policies accounting for environmental, political, labor, equity, and economic interestPerform data analysis and computer modeling to assess the impacts of clean industrial policy options on emissions, jobs, GDP, public health, equity, and other relevant metricsCustomize analyses for specific decision-makers, policymaking opportunities, and venues to accelerate industrial emissions reductionsCollaborate with other programs within Energy Innovation when needed

Communication

Write memos and reports about industrial technologies and policies, making complex technical material succinct and readily understandable for policymakers and similar audiencesDevelop recommendations for stakeholders (including policymakers, media, and others) with sensitivity to the political implications of the topics researched and how research is presentedCustomize recommendations to different geographies reflecting local conditions, government structure, and preexisting policiesCreate and incorporate data graphics into written material and online data visualizationsDeliver presentations and briefings for policymakers and members of the mediaSupport the Executive Director of Policy Research and Senior Director of Industry in the development and implementation of strategic goals and activities, funder reporting, etc.

Experience And Skills

Understanding of scientific and technical subject matter relating to causes of climate change, energy technologies, industrial process and energy-related emissions, and policy designDemonstrated excellence in writing about technical subjects for a non-technical audience, including the ability to write in different styles (word count, level of detail, etc.) for specific publications that range from technical reports to media articlesExperience working on high impact, policy-relevant environmental and/or energy projectsExperience working with or studying chemistry, thermodynamics, and/or materials scienceProficiency in data analysis using Microsoft ExcelEffective and flexible interpersonal and verbal communication skillsDeep interest, passion, and commitment to reducing climate changeAbility to prioritize and be flexible in a fast-paced, constantly evolving, and collaborative environmentWillingness to travel domestically and, on some occasions, internationally

Preferred Experience

Understanding of industrial processes, technologies, and operations, especially for high-emitting industries such as iron and steel, cement, and chemicalsProficiency in at least one data analysis tool other than a spreadsheet program, such as a programming language (Python, R, etc.) or scientific computing softwareExperience with developing or using economy-wide energy models (like the Energy Policy Simulator) or similar modelsExperience with energy and environmental regulatory agencies and legislative processes in the U.S., China, Europe, and/or IndiaExperience advising policymakers or regulators, helping to get policy enacted and ensuring that policies are well-designed to achieve their intended goalsExperience working with or studying economics relating to the topics of labor, offshoring, supply chains, and industrial competitivenessUnderstanding of the electric grid, grid management, hydrogen technology, carbon capture, and their relationship to industrial energy consumers

SALARY 

Energy Innovation provides a salary commensurate with qualifications and experience, with local adjustments made for folks outside of the San Francisco and D.C. area due to the cost of living. The target salary range is $90,000 to $100,000 for San Francisco or D.C. Currently, all staff local to the D.C. or San Francisco offices go into the office one to three days a week.

Benefits

Energy Innovation provides a comprehensive benefits package. The benefits include:

Up to 100% of premium paid for medical, dental, and visionShort term and long term disability insuranceCompany sponsored life insurance and voluntary lifeCarrot fertility and family planning benefitsStudent loan repayment assistance401k retirement plan with a company match contributionAnnual professional development budgetInternet, cell phone, and health & wellness reimbursement14 paid holidays and four weeks of paid time off (PTO)Paid parental leave, jury duty, and bereavementPublic transportation benefit options for office staffRegular staff lunches and team building activitiesSF and DC office stocked with healthy snacks and beveragesAn innovative, collaborative, welcoming work culture

About Us

Climate change is governed by physical facts—about carbon sources, accumulation, impacts, and timing. It’s also caused by economic and political systems that have led to a fossil fuel dependent energy system. These facts must inform strategy: they show that avoiding dangerous climate change is only possible through strong policy to cut carbon, promptly, in the biggest countries.

To address these issues, Energy Innovation was established in 2012 as a clean energy and environmental policy firm to provide timely research and analysis on low-carbon energy policy options to policy makers, thought leaders, and members of the media. The Energy Innovation team has expertise in clean energy, industry, transportation, buildings, technological innovation, and energy policy design. In addition to conducting policy research, Energy Innovation also works with clients to inform philanthropic investments into technology and advocacy that help reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

Energy Innovation supports a hybrid work environment and requires all employees to come together in person two to three times per year.

Description:
Responsibilities

 About TikTok U.S. Data Security
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a subsidary of TikTok in the U.S. This new, security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and U.S. user data, so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained. The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span across Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

About the Team
This role will sit within the USDS Product Policy Team and specialize in Integrity and Authenticity. Maximizing our commitment to free expression while ensuring the safety of our community is the team's north star. You will need to cultivate a deep understanding of the platform, its features and workflows, and its diverse community. The role will need to apply this knowledge to ensure that our policies and enforcement processes respect political speech as well as one's ability to express political opinions. We are dedicated to mitigating real world harm while safeguarding civic institutions and processes, like voting and political engagement. This will require developing systems for tracking and anticipating user behavior and identifying thoughtful and creative policy solutions in a rapidly-changing environment. You will work closely with a variety of internal partners including global policy experts on Integrity and Elections,Threat Discovery and Prevention, Product, and Legal Policy Operations to ensure that TikTok is able to detect, triage, and prevent safety incidents. It can be based in Los Angeles or New York.
Our Product Policy team performs a critical function that supports our efforts to address objectionable or disturbing content. Content that the Product Policy team interacts with includes images, video, and text related to every-day life, but it can also include (but is not limited to) bullying; hate speech; child abuse; sexual assault; torture; bestiality; self-harm; suicide; and murder. 
It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content on a daily basis.

Responsibilities:
- Rapidly assess large volumes of user content and provide policy calibrations based on ever-changing real-world contexts
- Rely on data-driven assessments of integrity and authenticity content to inform policy development, training and scaling of enforcement tools 
- Support preparation for the platform's election and civic integrity work by detecting policy edge cases and proposing scalable solutions
- Proactively identify and evaluate emerging misinformation and conspiracy narratives and other real-world risks to our platform and drive solutions to help mitigate them 
- Work closely with cross-functional partners and external experts to stay up-to-date on emerging political, demographic, scientific and social media trends in the US to predict and prevent violations of TikTok's community guidelines 
- Assist team lead in providing comprehensive and ongoing training designed to inform the moderators about policy, procedures changes, recent trends, and updates
- Become conversant with new tactics, techniques, and patterns used by adversarial and abusive parties to interfere with critical civic processes, spread harmful misinformation, and circumvent platform safety mechanisms. 
- Execute research projects and provide summaries about salient new academic work on misinformation and content safety interventions. Responsibilities include research, work planning, data collection & analysis
- Analyze existing policies and procedures to identify gaps, inconsistencies, or conflicts 

Qualifications

 Qualifications
- Over 3 years of work experience in Trust & Safety, content policy, or brand safety roles or another relevant field with a focus on civic Integrity (i.e, elections) and harmful misinformation 
- A deep interest in and knowledge about current events and politics
- Experience with trust and safety best practices, safety models, scalable solutions, safety by design principles and technical tools
- Ability to work with multiple external partners (i.e., vendor operations) to ensure our policy and procedure expectations are met 
- A careful and systematic thought process about how to leverage data and insights to inform policy development
- Some background in operations, with a proven ability to structure policy and process-oriented milestones 
- Deep knowledge in how policy develops in new media, technology, entertainment, or related fields

Preferred qualifications:
- Understanding how machine learning models are applied to safety problems
- Familiarity with AI-generated content trends
- Proven ability to develop sound research methodologies and collect, synthesize, analyze, and interpret data
- Experience managing complex research projects
- Experience working in a start-up, or forming new teams in established companies
- Advanced proficiency in Excel and understanding of data access tools, including but not limited to SQL
- Your ability to work in a high tempo environment, adapt, respond to day-to-day challenges of the role.
- Your resilience and commitment to self-care to manage the emotional demands of the role.

Wellbeing Statement
Trust & Safety recognizes that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job. It can be rewarding, psychologically demanding, and emotionally taxing. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start: so our candidates are well informed before proceeding.

We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

D&I Statement
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Accommodation Statement
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/ktJP6

About Us

Americans for Responsible Innovation (ARI) is a new nonprofit organization dedicated to policy advocacy in the public interest for emerging technology, including artificial intelligence (AI). We believe in establishing a thoughtful governance framework for rapidly advancing technologies that recognizes the importance of safety while continuing to foster innovation.

The organization is currently small, but expects to grow to a team of 8-10 staff by the end of 2024. Our goal is to become one of the major players influencing AI policy.

ARI was founded in late 2023 by Brad Carson, a former member of Congress, and Eric Gastfriend, a tech entrepreneur. Our SVP of Government Affairs is a former Senate Chief of Staff.

Compensation

Salary: $85,000 - $95,000, commensurate with experience.

ARI covers 85% of healthcare, vision, and dental insurance premiums.

About the job

ARI’s mission is to help U.S. policymakers develop a thoughtful governance framework for rapidly advancing technologies that protects the public from harm while continuing to foster innovation. To succeed in this mission, we need a knowledgeable and detail-oriented policy analyst to curate, analyze, and communicate the best policy proposals developed by a broad range of actors including think tanks, universities, congressional offices, executive branch agencies, and international bodies. The person in this role will be responsible for conducting in-depth research into potential policy proposals for ARI, maintaining ARI’s working knowledge of existing policy research for consideration, and coordinating ARI’s work with think tanks and other advocacy organizations. The person in this role will also serve as a technical expert with policymakers and other important stakeholders.

The right candidate for this role will have a deep expertise in AI policy, superior writing ability, and a demonstrated ability to work effectively with a range of experts. The right candidate need not have a technical AI background, but must have a strong grasp on the details, strengths, and potential shortcomings of the various AI policy proposals likely to be under consideration by Congress and federal agencies now and in the near future.

This role reports directly to the Senior Vice President of Government Affairs. ARI staff follow a hybrid schedule, with in-person work expected two to three days per week. Remote work is possible and acceptable on days when in-person presence is not required.

Responsibilities

  • Stay on top of (a) AI progress, (b) the relevant academic literature, and (c) AI policy conversations happening in and around DC
  • Help the ARI team develop, refine, and communicate ARI’s policy goals
  • Prepare detailed analysis and recommendations of potential AI policy priorities for ARI to champion
  • Draft summaries of proposed legislation, executive branch actions, and policy briefs
  • Conduct research and draft memoranda to help prepare ARI staff for meetings with Members of Congress and congressional staff
  • Conduct in-depth policy research on policy proposals and stay up-to-date on policy proposals prepared by leading think tanks in the space
  • Closely track and analyze all proposed legislation and executive branch actions regarding AI; maintain familiarity with state-level and international proposals regarding AI
  • Track AI policy news and alert ARI leadership of major developments that have not been widely reported
  • Other tasks outside of policy, as needed – we’re a small team and we all need to wear many hats

About you

You may be a good fit for this career opportunity, if you have:

  • A Bachelor’s or graduate degree in a related field (e.g. Public Policy)
  • Strong communication skills
  • Excellent research skills
  • Superior writing ability
  • Humility that you don’t have all the answers and are excited to work with numerous collaborators
  • Experience helping experts engage in non-academic processes
  • Comfort working in a political arena
  • Passion for the responsible development of AI and emerging technology.
  • Alignment with ARI’s mission and values
  • Reputation for trustworthiness and integrity
  • Comfort working in a dynamic early startup environment that lacks the stability and structure of a more established organization
  • Optional: Technical background in AI/ML

We value and celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive work environment for all. We welcome applicants of all kinds and are committed to providing an equal opportunity process.

How to apply

In addition to applying via LinkedIn, please send an email to hr@responsibleinnovation.org with the following information:

  • A “Cover Letter,” which can be just a few sentences, introducing who you are, what makes you a fit for the role, and why you care about the issue.
  • One paragraph describing 1-3 AI policy goals you believe would be positive for society.
  • [Optional] Links to relevant writing samples on tech/AI policy, if you have any that can be shared.
